Package com.github.tommyettinger.anim8

Class AnimatedPNG

java.lang.Object
com.github.tommyettinger.anim8.AnimatedPNG
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Disposable, AnimationWriter
public class AnimatedPNG
extends java.lang.Object
implements AnimationWriter, com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Disposable
Full-color animated PNG encoder with compression. This type of animated PNG supports both full color and a full alpha channel; it does not reduce the colors to match a palette. If your image does not have a full alpha channel and has 256 or fewer colors, you can use AnimatedGif or the animated mode of PNG8, which have comparable APIs. An instance can be reused to encode multiple animated PNGs with minimal allocation.

  • Constructor Details

    • AnimatedPNG

      public AnimatedPNG()
      Creates an AnimatedPNG writer with an initial buffer size of 16384. The buffer can resize later if needed.

    • AnimatedPNG

      public AnimatedPNG​(int initialBufferSize)
      Creates an AnimatedPNG writer with the given initial buffer size. The buffer can resize if needed, so using a small size is only a problem if it slows down writing by forcing a resize for several parts of a PNG. A default of 16384 is reasonable.
      Parameters:
      initialBufferSize - the initial size for the buffer that stores PNG chunks; 16384 is a reasonable default

  • Method Details

    • setFlipY

      public void setFlipY​(boolean flipY)
      If true, the resulting AnimatedPNG is flipped vertically. Default is true.

    • setCompression

      public void setCompression​(int level)
      Sets the deflate compression level. Default is Deflater.DEFAULT_COMPRESSION, which is currently 6 on all Java versions in the 8 to 14 range, but is permitted to change.

    • write

      public void write​(com.badlogic.gdx.files.FileHandle file, com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Array<com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Pixmap> frames)
      Writes an animated PNG file consisting of the given frames to the given file, at 60 frames per second. This doesn't guarantee that the animated PNG will be played back at a steady 60 frames per second, just that the duration of each frame is 1/60 of a second if playback is optimal.
      Specified by:
      write in interface AnimationWriter
      Parameters:
      file - the file location to write to; any existing file with this name will be overwritten
      frames - an Array of Pixmap frames to write in order to the animated PNG

    • write

      public void write​(com.badlogic.gdx.files.FileHandle file, com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Array<com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Pixmap> frames, int fps)
      Writes an animated PNG file consisting of the given frames to the given file, at fps frames per second.
      Specified by:
      write in interface AnimationWriter
      Parameters:
      file - the file location to write to; any existing file with this name will be overwritten
      frames - an Array of Pixmap frames to write in order to the animated PNG
      fps - how many frames per second the animated PNG should display

    • write

      public void write​(java.io.OutputStream output, com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Array<com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.Pixmap> frames, int fps)
      Writes animated PNG data consisting of the given frames to the given output stream without closing the stream, at fps frames per second.
      Specified by:
      write in interface AnimationWriter
      Parameters:
      output - the stream to write to; the stream will not be closed
      frames - an Array of Pixmap frames to write in order to the animated PNG
      fps - how many frames per second the animated PNG should display

    • dispose

      public void dispose()
      Disposal should probably be done explicitly, especially if using JRE versions after 8. In Java 8 and earlier, you could rely on finalize() doing what this does, but that isn't a safe assumption in Java 9 and later. Note, don't use the same AnimatedPNG object after you call this method; you'll need to make a new one if you need to write again after disposing.
      Specified by:
      dispose in interface com.badlogic.gdx.utils.Disposable
